question: You recently attended a meeting at a hotel. When you returned home, you found you had left some important papers at the hotel. Write a letter to the manager of the hotel. In your letter.•	Say where you think you left the papers•	Explain why they are so important•	Tell the manager what you want him /her to do
text: I am writing this letter to inform you that I have left an important document in your hotel, during my visit to your hotel last week to attend a business conference and stayed for a couple of days.
I’m Jessica, during my stay I was in room number 234 which was located near to the lift. I have placed my documents inside the locker, which was inbuilt in the wardrobe.

The papers I left there are crucial as they are agreement document which we signed up with our new client. As it contains information on terms, conditions and other confidential details of our customer, I need those papers urgently. I hope you understand the seriousness and how vital are those documents.

Hence, I request you to kindly send those document through a registered post at the earliest as possible. Please be informed, the password to access the locker is '8982'. Also, I am glad to make a bank transfer for the postal charges occurred. I would appreciate if you could treat this matter with utmost urgency.
